title: Selection box doesn't follow element during drag
description:
When dragging a selected element, the blue selection border stays in place and only snaps to the element's new position when dragging stops. The selection box should move in real-time with the element during drag operations.

Observed: Selection box remains static during drag, then jumps to final position
Expected: Selection box moves continuously with the element being dragged

This creates visual disconnect and makes it harder to judge placement during drag operations.
close_reason: Closed

title: Resize handles render behind overlapping elements
description:
When an element is selected, the resize drag handles (white corner circles) can be obscured by other overlapping elements on the canvas. The handles should always render on top of all canvas content to ensure they remain clickable/draggable regardless of element stacking order.

Observed: Selection handles appear behind other images (see screenshot)
Expected: Handles should always be on top, fully visible and interactive

Fix likely involves setting higher z-index on the selection handles group in canvas.js or CSS.

title: Add OPML export/import for canvas hierarchy
description:
Implement OPML (Outline Processor Markup Language) export and import for the canvas hierarchy.

## Why OPML
- Standard XML-based outlining format
- Handles hierarchical data (canvas tree with folders) naturally
- Robust against special characters in labels (proper XML escaping)
- Widely supported by outline tools, can interop with other apps

## Export
- Export entire canvas tree to .opml file
- Each canvas becomes an outline node
- Folder elements create child nodes linking to their target canvases
- Include element metadata as OPML attributes or nested nodes
- Handle images: either embed as base64 or reference external paths

## Import
- Load .opml file and reconstruct canvas hierarchy
- Create canvases for each outline node
- Recreate folder links between canvases
- Handle image references appropriately

## UI
- Export OPML button in toolbar (alongside existing JSON export)
- Import OPML option (alongside existing JSON import)
- Consider: export single canvas vs export entire tree

## Replaces
- Current naive markdown/ASCII indent format
- More rigorous than current JSON export for hierarchy
close_reason: Implemented OPML export/import - commit 288365a

title: Add grid/snap alignment option for precise element positioning
description:
Add grid overlay and snap-to-grid functionality for precise element positioning.

## Visual Grid
- Toggleable visible grid overlay on canvas
- Grid spacing: 20-50px range, configurable via CONFIG
- Grid toggle via toolbar button + keyboard shortcut

## Snap Behavior
- Elements snap while dragging (magnetic threshold ~5-10px)
- Snap to grid lines when enabled
- Snap toggle via toolbar button + keyboard shortcut
- Independent toggles: can have grid visible without snap, or snap without visible grid

## UI
- Toolbar buttons for grid visibility and snap toggle
- Keyboard shortcuts (e.g., G for grid, S for snap)
- Add to keyboard help overlay
close_reason: Implemented grid/snap feature - commit e86f69b

title: Redesign toolbar with Linear-inspired dark minimal aesthetic
description:
Current toolbar icons are functional but lack polish. Redesign to match Linear's aesthetic:

Linear design characteristics:
- Dark backgrounds with subtle borders
- Monochrome icons with consistent stroke weight
- Subtle hover states (slight background or opacity change)
- Clean spacing and alignment
- Muted colors, accent color used sparingly
- Icons are simple line art, not filled

Current issues:
- Color palette icons look dated (solid circles)
- Mixed icon styles
- Lacks cohesive visual language

Goals:
- Unified icon style (outline/stroke based)
- Darker, more subtle color picker
- Consistent hover/active states
- Better visual hierarchy
